name: Angeles Volunteer Association
description: We staff and maintain the Crystal Lake Visitor Center on weekends and holidays. We staff the Azusa Gateway Center and the entrance to the forest on Highway 39 also on weekends and holidays.  We hold trash removal events, usually at the Crystal Lake Recreation Area, perform trail patrols so we can be current on trail conditions, arrange clean-up work at the lake and general maintenance around the campground areas.
requirements: Our organization is open to the public, we hold monthly meetings on the third Tuesday of the month.  No special skill set is required.  We want our volunteers to be educated about the Crystal Lake Recreation Area and the San Gabriel Canyon environment.

name: America's Great Outdoors
description: Main event: Los Angeles County Fair providing education on Wildfire Prevention, California History (Native American Site, BLM Land - Gold Mining and General Lands Office history, Cross Cut sawing, Native Reptiles, Leave No Trace, Fire Lookout Tower, etc.  We work with Angeles and San Bernardino National Forest, BLM and LA County Fire Forest Division. Throughout the year we have ground maintenance on 1 1/2 acres at the Pomona Fairgrounds, including development of new activities, trail maintenance, etc
requirements: Open to the Public, no need for specialized skills. High School age or higher. Under age 18 to be accompanied by an adult.

name: JPL Trailbuilders
description: Trail maintenance on Mt Lowe East and West Trails, Muir Peak Trail, Colby Canyon Trail, South San Gabriel Peak Trail, North San Gabriel Peak Trail (sometimes called Bill Reilly Trail)
requirements: Our events are open to the public

name: Lowelifes Respectable Citizens' Club
description: Trail work: restoration and maintenance. Lowelifes is currently focused on the restoration of Condor Peak Trail. When that project is complete, we will move on to other trails in the Forest.
requirements: Volunteers need to be physically fit and otherwise prepared for physical labor in backcountry areas. Our work days are open to the public, depending on space.

name: San Gabriel Mountains Trail Builders
description: Trail repair, construction, workshops, sign installation. Most of the trails are in the national monument
requirements: No special skills required, open to everyone.

name: Bear Canyon Trail Crew
description: Trail construction and repair. Bear Canyon Trail and other trails as necessary.
requirements: No special skills required. Open to everyone.
